intro: Pouteria pohlmaniana, commonly known as the Pohnpei hibiscus, is a tropical tree native to the Caroline Islands. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant produces a fleshy, orange-colored fruit that is edible and often consumed by local communities. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food for various wildlife species.
